Posts.Content: My dad was diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer last year. He’s 69 years old. He’s a very, very stubborn man who has told his doctor numerous times that he’s not going to go through radiation or operation. I haven’t had a deep conversation as to why he refuses to do either. I’m assuming it’s either pride or he’s fear. He instead chose to do take homeopathic medicine to “cure” him because he’s a firm believer of that. He’s gone to Mexico to get this medication because a family friend’s nephew specializes in homeopathic remedies. He swears that this is helping, although his PSA levels say otherwise. I wish I knew his scores and information, but I don’t have that with me. He received a second opinion on Wednesday and was told the same thing that he needs to get the proper treatment and now the doctor worries that the cancer has spread because of its aggressiveness. I know I have to talk to my dad again as well as my other siblings. But would any of you know what the chances are if it already spread out of the prostate? I know his numbers would help and every case is different. I’m just so scared, sad and just losing sleep over this. Thank you all and wish you all the best.
Posts.Title: Worried about my dad

Posts.Content: Hello, my father is getting this test done tomorrow. Is this a standard test thats done? If so, how was your experience with it? And what is good/bad about it? What type of results should we hope to get back? Thanks so much!!
Posts.Title: FDG-PET Scan

Posts.Content: My dad received some results on his acid phosphate and prostatic acid phosphate. His scores are: 3.9 & 2.1. Ive read some information, but I was wondering if any of you would be able to clear this up for me? Thanks so much!
Posts.Title: Educate me on Acid phosphate
